snippet: On May 23, after a two-and-a-half-year renovation, the Met will open 45 reimagined and expanded galleries, increasing the space for European paintings by nearly a third.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Metropolitan Museum of Art plans to unveil 45 reimagined and expanded galleries, increasing space for European paintings by nearly one-third; Lincoln Center is poised to become as coveted destination for contemporary artists as it is for actors, singers and dancers; 200 works from Peter Brant's collection of Andy Warhol works are to be presented together for first time at Brant Foundation Art Study Center.
lead_paragraph: On May 23, after a two-and-a-half-year renovation, the Met will open 45 reimagined and expanded galleries, increasing the space for European paintings by nearly a third.

headline.seo: Met Is Ready to Unveil New European Paintings Galleries
headline.main: Met Is Ready to Unveil New European Paintings Galleries
